keyTakeAways: Mohammed Ibrahim, a 16-year-old Palestinian American teenager, has been detained in Israeli prisons since February 2023 after a raid on his family’s home in the West Bank.
He describes severe conditions including cold, thin mattresses, meagre meals (three pieces of bread, a spoonful of labneh, half a cup of dry rice, a sausage, and no fruit), and no dinner or fruit.
He has lost considerable weight due to insufficient food and poor living conditions in detention facilities such as Megiddo and Ofer.
He was beaten with rifle butts during arrest and has been charged with throwing stones at Israeli settlers, an accusation he denies.
Defense for Children International – Palestine (DCIP) and human rights groups argue that Israel is the only country that systematically prosecutes children in military courts.
Despite being a US citizen, he lacks protection from US authorities, with his family and Congress pleading with President Donald Trump to intervene.
Congresswoman Ayanna Pressley and other US lawmakers are urging the administration to use diplomatic leverage to secure his release.
At least 79 Palestinian detainees have died in Israeli jails since the Gaza war began in October 2023 due to lack of medical care, poor nutrition, and violence.
Medical officials in Gaza report signs of torture and execution on bodies of detainees released after the Gaza ceasefire deal, increasing global concern.
Mohammed’s father, Zaher Ibrahim, believes the Trump administration could free his son with a single phone call but says they feel ignored by US power structures.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Mohammed Ibrahim, a 16-year-old Palestinian American teenager, has been detained in Israeli prisons since February 2023 after a military raid on his family’s home in the West Bank. He describes enduring severe conditions including cold, thin mattresses, extremely insufficient meals with no fruit or dinner, and physical abuse during arrest. He has lost significant weight and is charged with an accusation he denies. Human rights groups, including Defense for Children International – Palestine (DCIP), argue that Israel is the only country that systematically prosecutes children in military courts. Despite being a US citizen, he has not received protection from the US government, with family and US lawmakers, including Congresswoman Ayanna Pressley, urging President Donald Trump to intervene. The case has gained urgency following the Gaza ceasefire deal, which led to the release of other Palestinian detainees and renewed global attention. Meanwhile, at least 79 Palestinian detainees have died in Israeli jails since October 2023 due to lack of medical care and poor conditions. The situation raises serious concerns about child rights, international diplomacy, and the safety of US citizens in occupied territories.
title: Cold cells, meagre meals: Palestinian American boy suffers in Israeli jail
